text.text_translated: Most types of spiders have venom. Venom is a poison they use to stop or kill their food, not to attack humans. In fact, only 25 known types of spider make venom that can actually harm humans. Although their bites can be painful, they rarely kill people. Australia's dangerous Sydney funnel-web spider has not caused any deaths since 1981. This is because a special medicine called anti-venom was created then. However, you should take care not to annoy hairy spiders like tarantulas. When they feel they are in danger, they defend themselves by releasing a cloud of irritating hairs. These hairs can get stuck in the skin or eyes of an attacker.
